title: 2025-Data Analyst, Predictive Analytics, India- X Delivery
description:
Locations: Bengaluru | Gurgaon

Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

What You'll Do

As a part of BCG X A&A team, you will work closely with consulting teams on a diverse range of advanced analytics topics. You will have the opportunity to leverage analytical methodologies to deliver value to BCG's Consulting (case) teams and Practice Areas (domain) through providing analytics subject matter expertise, and accelerated execution support. You will collaborate with case teams to gather requirements, specify, design, develop, deliver and support analytic solutions serving client needs. You will provide technical support through deeper understanding of relevant data analytics solutions and processes to build high quality and efficient analytic solutions.

YOU'RE GOOD AT
• Working with case (and proposal) teams
• Acquiring deep expertise in at least one analytics topic & understanding of all analytics capabilities
• Defining and explaining expected analytics outcome; defining approach selection
• Delivering original analysis and insights to BCG teams, typically owning all or part of an analytics module and integrating with case teams
• Establishing credibility by thought partnering with case teams on analytics topics; drawing conclusions on a range of external and internal issues related to their module
• Communicating analytical insights through sophisticated synthesis and packaging of results (including PowerPoint presentation, Documents, dashboard and charts) with consultants, collects, synthesizes, analyses case team learning & inputs into new best practices and methodologies
• Build collateral of documents for enhancing core capabilities and supporting reference for internal documents; sanitizing confidential documents and maintaining a repository
• Able to lead workstreams and modules independently or with minimal supervision
• Ability to support business development activities (proposals, vignettes etc.) and build sales collateral to generate leads
• Team requirements: Guides juniors on analytical methodologies and platforms, and helps in quality checks
• Contributes to team's content & IP development
• Imparts technical trainings to team members and consulting cohort
• Technical Skills: Strong proficiency in statistics (concepts & methodologies like hypothesis testing, sampling, etc.) and its application & interpretation
• Hands-on data mining and predictive modeling experience (Linear Regression, Clustering (K-means, DBSCAN, etc.), Classification (Logistic regression, Decision trees/Random Forest/Boosted Trees), Timeseries (SARIMAX/Prophet)etc.
• Strong experience in at least one of the prominent cloud providers (Azure, AWS, GCP) and working knowledge of auto ML solutions (Sage Maker, Azure ML etc.)
• At least one tool in each category;
• Programming language - Python (Must have), (R Or SAS OR PySpark), SQL (Must have)
• Data Visualization (Tableau, QlikView, Power BI, Streamlit) ,
• Data management (using Alteryx, MS Access, or any RDBMS)
• ML Deployment tools (Airflow, MLflow Luigi, Docker etc.)
• Big data technologies ( Hadoop ecosystem, Spark)
• Data warehouse solutions (Teradata, Azure SQL DW/Synapse, Redshift, BigQuery etc,)
• Version Control (Git/Github/Git Lab)
• MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
• Coding IDE (VS Code/PyCharm)
• GenAI tools (OpenAI, Google PaLM/BERT, Hugging Face, etc.)
• Functional Skills:
• Expertise in building analytical solutions and delivering tangible business value for clients (similar to the use cases below)
• Price optimization, promotion effectiveness, Product assortment optimization and sales force effectiveness, Personalization/Loyalty programs, Labor Optimization
• CLM and revenue enhancement (segmentation, cross-sell/up-sell, next product to buy, offer recommendation, loyalty, LTV maximization and churn prevention)
• Communicating with confidence and ease: You will be a clear and confident communicator, able to deliver messages in a concise manner with strong and effective written and verbal communication.

What You'll Bring
• Bachelor/Master's degree in a field linked to business analytics, statistics or economics, operations research, applied mathematics, computer science, engineering, or related field required; advanced degree preferred
• At least 2-4 years of relevant industry work experience providing analytics solutions in a commercial setting
• Prior work experience in a global organization, preferably in a professional services organization in data analytics role
• Demonstrated depth in one or more industries not limited to but including Retail, CPG, Healthcare, Telco etc
• Prior work experience in a global organization, preferably in a professional services organization in data analytics role to join our ranks. #BCGXjob #LI-ND1

Who You'll Work With

Our data analytics and artificial intelligence professionals mix deep domain expertise with advanced analytical methods and techniques to develop innovative solutions that help our clients tackle their most pressing issues. We design algorithms and build complex models out of large amounts of data.

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: Data Analyst Trainee
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst Trainee to join our dynamic team in Jaipur. This is an excellent opportunity for a recent graduate or a fresher looking to kickstart their career in the field of data analytics. You will work alongside experienced analysts and contribute to data-driven decision-making processes across the organization. You will receive hands-on training and mentorship to develop your skills in data collection, processing, analysis, and visualization.

RESPONSIBILITIES

- Assist in collecting and interpreting data from various sources.
- Clean, preprocess, and validate data to ensure accuracy and completeness.
- Perform initial analysis and identify trends, patterns, and insights.
- Support senior analysts in creating reports, dashboards, and visualizations.
- Collaborate with different teams to understand their data needs and provide support.
- Help maintain databases and data systems.
- Document data analysis processes and methodologies.

REQUIREMENTS

- Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
- Basic understanding of SQL and database concepts.
- Proficiency in Microsoft Excel for data manipulation and analysis.
- Familiarity with any data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Google Data Studio is a plus.
- Knowledge of statistical concepts is an advantage.
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
- A logical and systematic approach to problem-solving.
- Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.

QUALIFICATIONS

- Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
- Recent graduates or final-year students are encouraged to apply.
- A strong passion for data and a desire to learn new technologies.

WHAT WE OFFER

- A structured training program and mentorship from industry experts.
- Exposure to real-world business problems and data sets.
- A collaborative and supportive work environment.
- Opportunity for a full-time position based on performance.
- Competitive stipend.

title: Sr. Data Analyst, AdTech/Omnichannel (Remote, India)
description:

The position is ideal for a proactive, technically skilled professional passionate about data, analytics, and AdTech/omnichannel solutions.Jobgether is a Talent Matching Platform that partners with companies worldwide to efficiently connect top talent with the right opportunities through AI-driven job matching.When you apply, your profile goes through our AI-powered screening process designed to identify top talent efficiently and fairly. Based on this analysis, we automatically shortlist the three candidates with the highest match to the role. Once the shortlist is completed, we share it directly with the company that owns the job opening. The final decision and next steps (such as interviews or additional assessments) are then made by their internal hiring team.Thank you for your interest!

title: Data Analyst - Ecommerce & D2C Insights
description:
Job Description: Data Analyst - Ecommerce & D2C Insights

WHAT WE DO AND WHO WE ARE

Join the dynamic team at Wholsum Foods and be part of an extraordinary movement! Our mission is simple: to change the way the world eats. With brands like Slurrp Farm and Mille, we offer healthy and delicious alternatives to the junk food epidemic. It's time to rediscover the nutritious traditions of our ancestors and embrace the power of millets like Ragi, Jowar, Bajra, and Foxtail Millet.

Led by founders Shauravi Malik and Meghana Narayan, we are food enthusiasts, entrepreneurs, and mothers committed to making a difference. We're expanding globally and seeking talented individuals who thrive in a collaborative, innovative, and high-growth environment. Join us and embark on a rewarding journey where you can grow professionally while having a blast!

At Wholsum Foods, we celebrate diversity and unity, all driven by a shared mission to revolutionize the way we eat. Our team is our greatest asset, and our core values - Relationship First, Dependable, Passionate, and Growth Mindset - bring out the best in each team member. We take pride in being an equal opportunity workplace, embracing individuals regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or gender identity. Together, we will redefine the future of food!

We are also Great Place to Work Certified.

ABOUT THE ROLE:

We’re looking for a data-pro who can turn scattered information into sharp, actionable intelligence. Someone who enjoys connecting sales, marketing, supply chain, and customer behavior into one clean storyline — and can tell you what happened, why it happened, and what to do next.

This role directly influences marketing efficiency, revenue growth, supply chain planning, and website performance.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

1. Business Intelligence & Daily Analytics
• Consolidate SKU-wise daily sales, spends, ROAS, supply chain fill rates, and availability data across all channels.
• Build unified dashboards that merge all these layers into a single view of truth.
• Use AI to automate insights, detect anomalies, and generate predictive commentary.

2. Root-Cause Diagnosis Across Functions
• Investigate business dips or changes and correlate multiple data streams to explain them.
• Example: If sales drop on a specific channel or SKU, break it down into:
• marketing spends → performance campaigns → traffic & CVR → availability → fill rate → dispatch delays → competition trends.
• Provide a clear narrative of what happened and why — and recommend actionable next steps.

3. Predictive Analytics & Stock Planning
• Build models to forecast demand, project stock requirement, and predict potential stockouts based on sales trends, seasonality, campaign plans, and category velocity.
• Help the supply planning team prepare accurate input planning and replenishment cycles.
• Flag risk zones early — possible OOS, aging inventory, slow movers, or demand spikes.

4. Marketing & Performance Optimization
• Analyze spends across Google, Meta, WhatsApp and identify leakages, inefficiencies, and opportunity losses.
• Build clear insights that connect marketing inputs to business outcomes.
• Identify experiments, measure results, and communicate insights simply and impactfully.

5. D2C Funnel & Website Journey Analytics
• Map and improve full funnel behavior from ads → landing page → add-to-cart → checkout → repeat.
• Identify friction points and work with product/dev teams to increase CVR and reduce drop-offs.
• Build cohorts, LTV models, retention triggers, and customer segments.

6. Tooling, Automation & Advanced Analytics
• Build automated reporting pipelines via SQL, Python/R, and dashboarding tools like Looker, Power BI, Tableau.
• Integrate multiple data sources (CRM, website analytics, marketing platforms, platform APIs).
• Use AI tools to increase speed, accuracy, and decision-making quality.

MUST HAVE SKILL:
• Solid in SQL, Python/R (bonus), Excel, GA4, Meta/Google dashboards, and BI tools.
• 3–6 years in data analytics within ecommerce, D2C, FMCG, or consumer internet.
• Strong understanding of performance marketing metrics, funnel analytics, and attribution.
• Experience with ecommerce/D2C platforms and multi-source data correlation.
• Ability to convert insights into clear business actions, not just reports.
• Experience forecasting demand, analyzing availability, and working with supply chain metrics.
• A mindset of investigation, experimentation, and continuous optimization.

NICE TO HAVE SKILLS
• Knowledge of CDPs (WebEngage, Clevertap, MoEngage).
• Basic understanding of API integrations and automation scripts.
• Experience with predictive models and time-series forecasting.

LOCATION: GOLF COURSE ROAD, GURUGRAM

START DATE: Immediately

title: Senior Data Analyst-Payments
description:
Teamwork makes the stream work.

Roku is changing how the world watches TV

Roku is the #1 TV streaming platform in the U.S., Canada, and Mexico, and we've set our sights on powering every television in the world. Roku pioneered streaming to the TV. Our mission is to be the TV streaming platform that connects the entire TV ecosystem. We connect consumers to the content they love, enable content publishers to build and monetize large audiences, and provide advertisers unique capabilities to engage consumers.

From your first day at Roku, you'll make a valuable - and valued - contribution. We're a fast-growing public company where no one is a bystander. We offer you the opportunity to delight millions of TV streamers around the world while gaining meaningful experience across a variety of disciplines.

About the Team 

The Core Payments team has been instrumental in Roku's exponential growth in online subscriptions, achieved through an in-streaming, on-TV purchase experience. Core Payments supports various teams across Roku; spanning multiple consumer interfaces, including TV, web, mobile, and advertising. These diverse teams have developed unique strategies for selling digital content access, encompassing Subscription Video on Demand/Transactional Video on Demand (SVOD/TVOD), company-branded devices, and on-device shoppable ads.

 About the Role 

We are seeking a Senior Data Analyst to join our dynamic Payments team. This individual will be tasked with investigating and developing solutions to track, monitor, and enhance our payment ecosystems. They will diagnose and proactively address emerging patterns, executing a strategy aimed at delivering an improved consumer and partner experience. The ideal candidate is analytically driven, detail-oriented, and possesses advanced problem-solving skills. They must have a deep understanding and experience in payments data, as they will collaborate closely with Product Managers and Operations teams to provide insights and performance-related details. 

What you'll be doing:
• Identify opportunities for improvement within our payment services, effectively communicating with product management and engineering teams 
• Lead the identification of issues and incidents, conduct business impact analysis, and engage with the wider team for resolution 
• Focus on optimising processing costs to deliver a positive impact on payment processing expenses 
• Oversee end-to-end payment processes and requirements, while contributing insights to develop world-class billing products and processes 
• Collaborate with internal teams to identify and implement strategies to accommodate evolving consumer payment preferences 
• Engage with internal and external partners to identify optimisation opportunities and contribute to building a world-class subscription payment processing and billing platform 
• Collaborate closely with the Payment Protection team to monitor fraud/risk patterns and minimise chargeback losses.

We're excited if you have:
• 8 years of experience as an Analyst, Consultant, or in a related occupation
• Quantitative analysis, including interpreting large, structured data and formulating recommendations 
• Performing data analysis, developing strategies, driving implementation, and delivering post-launch performance results 
• Strong proficiency in SQL, Hive QL, and Hadoop for data extraction and query optimization 
• Hands-on experience in visualization using Tableau or similar statistical/reporting packages 
• Proficiency in Python and Shell as scripting languages (preferred) 
• Advanced skills in MS Excel and MS PowerPoint 
• Experience in the payments/e-commerce domain 
• Working with transactional systems, processes, A/B tests, or analytics in a technology company 
• Real-world experience in Risk Management and Risk Analytics 
• Exposure to Incident/Escalations processes 
• In-depth knowledge of the Payment Product domain and Payment Service technical implementation stacks 
• Working collaboratively with multiple teams internally and externally 
• Bachelor's degree or foreign equivalent in Electronics Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or a related field 

Accommodations

Roku welcomes applicants of all backgrounds and provides reasonable accommodations and adjustments in accordance with applicable law. If you require reasonable accommodation at any point in the hiring process, please direct your inquiries to EmployeeRelations@Roku.com.

Our Hybrid Work Approach

Roku fosters an inclusive and collaborative environment where teams work in the office Monday through Thursday. Fridays are flexible for remote work except for employees whose roles are required to be in the office five days a week or employees who are in offices with a five day in office policy.

Benefits

Roku is committed to offering a diverse range of benefits as part of our compensation package to support our employees and their families. Our comprehensive benefits include global access to mental health and financial wellness support and resources. Local benefits include statutory and voluntary benefits which may include healthcare (medical, dental, and vision), life, accident, disability, commuter, and retirement options (401(k)/pension). Our employees can take time off work for vacation and other personal reasons to balance their evolving work and life needs. It's important to note that not every benefit is available in all locations or for every role. For details specific to your location, please consult with your recruiter.

The Roku Culture

Roku is a great place for people who want to work in a fast-paced environment where everyone is focused on the company's success rather than their own. We try to surround ourselves with people who are great at their jobs, who are easy to work with, and who keep their egos in check. We appreciate a sense of humor. We believe a fewer number of very talented folks can do more for less cost than a larger number of less talented teams. We're independent thinkers with big ideas who act boldly, move fast and accomplish extraordinary things through collaboration and trust. In short, at Roku you'll be part of a company that's changing how the world watches TV. 

We have a unique culture that we are proud of. We think of ourselves primarily as problem-solvers, which itself is a two-part idea. We come up with the solution, but the solution isn't real until it is built and delivered to the customer. That penchant for action gives us a pragmatic approach to innovation, one that has served us well since 2002. 

To learn more about Roku, our global footprint, and how we've grown, visit https://www.weareroku.com/factsheet.

By providing your information, you acknowledge that you want Roku to contact you about job roles, that you have read Roku's Applicant Privacy Notice, and understand that Roku will use your information as described in that notice. If you do not wish to receive any communications from Roku regarding this role or similar roles in the future, you may unsubscribe here at any time.

title: CarbyneTech - Data Analyst - R / Python
description:
Description : Job Overview :

We are seeking an experienced and highly analytical Senior Business Intelligence & Data Analyst to join our team.

In this role, you will collaborate with business stakeholders, data engineers, and data scientists to transform complex business needs into actionable insights and scalable data solutions.

You will be responsible for analyzing data, developing compelling dashboards, ensuring data quality, and supporting advanced analytics initiatives across the organization.

Key Responsibilities Collaboration & Requirements Gathering :
• Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand strategic objectives, gather detailed business requirements, and translate them into effective data-driven solutions.
• Lead and facilitate User Acceptance Testing (UAT) sessions, ensuring delivered solutions meet business expectations.
• Act as a trusted advisor to stakeholders by recommending analytical approaches and data-driven improvements.

Data Analysis & Insights :
• Analyze large volumes of structured and unstructured data using tools such as SQL, Power BI, and Excel to uncover trends, patterns, and insights.
• Perform deep-dive analyses and build data models to support decision-making and operational improvements.
• Present findings in a clear, compelling manner to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Reporting & Visualization :
• Develop, maintain, and optimize interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations that empower business users with self-service analytics.
• Establish best practices for data visualization, report design, and performance optimization.

Data Engineering & Advanced Analytics Support :
• Partner closely with data engineers to ensure data pipelines, ETL processes, and data models meet analytical and reporting requirements.
• Collaborate with data scientists to support advanced analytics, machine learning initiatives, and model deployment activities.

Data Quality & Governance :
• Conduct data profiling, validation, cleansing, and reconciliation to ensure the accuracy, completeness, and reliability of data.
• Support data governance initiatives by documenting data definitions, lineage, and quality standards.

Required Skills & Qualifications :
• 7+ years of experience in business intelligence, data analysis, or similar roles.
• Strong proficiency with Power BI, SQL, and Excel, including advanced data manipulation and visualization skills.
• Hands-on experience working with the Azure Data Ecosystem (e.g., Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse, Azure SQL, Data Lake).
• Proven track record in stakeholder management, with the ability to translate business needs into technical solutions.
• Solid understanding of data modeling concepts, including experience working with dimensional models and star / snowflake schemas.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex concepts clearly to diverse audiences.
• Strong problem-solving abilities and the capability to work both independently and collaboratively in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

Preferred Qualifications (Optional) (Include if desired) :
• Experience with Python or R for data analysis.
• Familiarity with machine learning concepts.
• Exposure to DevOps or CI / CD processes in data environments.
• Experience implementing BI governance or Center of Excellence (CoE) frameworks

title: Data Analyst Executive & Trainer
description:
Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst who will be responsible for conducting data analysis and delivering insightful reports while also training students and internal trainers. The ideal candidate should have strong analytical skills, a passion for teaching, and the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.

Key Responsibilities

1. Training & Facilitation

● Design and develop training materials, case studies, and real-time projects for students.

● Develop structured Train the Trainer (TTT) programs to train internal trainers on data analytic tools and methodologies.

● Conduct hands-on training sessions for students on topics related to data analytics and data visualization and make them capable to independently perform tasks.

● Continuously update training materials to incorporate the latest tools, technologies, and best practices in data analytics.

● Use engaging teaching methods, such as case studies, group discussions, and handson exercises, to enhance student understanding and retention.

2. Data Analysis & Reporting

● Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations using tools like Excel, Power BI, or Tableau to provide meaningful insights for business decisions.

● Work with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into actionable data insights.

● Continuously monitor and analyze operational data, highlighting critical trends and areas requiring management attention.

● Generate and present periodic reports (daily, weekly, monthly) to management on key business metrics and performance trends.

Skills & Qualifications Must-Have:

● Bachelor's or Master’s degree in any field, preferably commerce.

● Strong knowledge of SQL, Excel, Power BI, Tableau, Python, or R.

● Proven experience in data analysis, visualization, and reporting.

● Passion for upskilling and mentoring students and trainers.

● Fluency in Malayalam and English.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: ₹23,000.00 - ₹30,000.00 per month

Application Question(s):
• Are you interested in teaching?

Education:
• Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:
• Data analytics: 1 year (Required)

Language:
• English (Required)
• Malayalam (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Executive Data Analyst

title: Data Analyst, India - X Delivery
description:
Locations: Gurgaon | Bengaluru

Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures-and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

What You'll Do

As a part of BCG's X Delivery team you will work closely with practice areas on a diverse range of advanced analytics topics. You will have the opportunity to leverage analytical methodologies to deliver value to BCG's Consulting (case) teams and Practice Areas (domain) through providing analytics subject matter expertise, and accelerated execution support.

You will collaborate with PA or case teams to gather requirements, specify, design, develop, deliver and support analytic solutions serving client needs. You will provide technical support through deeper understanding of relevant data analytics solutions and processes to build high quality and efficient analytic solutions.

YOU'RE GOOD AT

Working with PA (and case) teams
• Working with case (and proposal) teams
• Acquiring deep expertise in at least one analytics topic & understanding of all analytics capabilities
• Defining and explaining expected analytics outcome defining approach selection
• Delivering original analysis and insights to BCG teams, typically owning all or part of an analytics module and integrating with case teams
• Establishing credibility by thought partnering with case teams on analytics topics drawing conclusions on a range of external and internal issues related to their module
• Communicating analytical insights through sophisticated synthesis and packaging of results (including Chatbot, PowerPoint presentation, Documents, dashboard and charts) with consultants, collects, synthesizes, analyses case team learning & inputs into new best practices and methodologies
• Build collateral of documents for enhancing core capabilities and supporting reference for internal documents sanitizing confidential documents and maintaining a repository
• Able to lead workstreams and modules independently or with minimal supervision
• Team requirements: Guides juniors on analytical methodologies and platforms, and helps in quality checks
• Contributes to team's content & IP development
• Imparts technical trainings to team members and consulting cohort

.Technical Skills:
• Strong proficiency in SQL, Python (NumPy, Pandas), Langchain, Langgraph or Agent-SDK and data visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI)
• Familiarity with LLMs, NLP, GenAI Concepts (OpenAI, Anthropic, Hugging face) and RAG (Chunking, embedding, Semantic search, retrieval strategies, optimization)
• Experience with Model Evaluation(Phoenix evals, RAGAS) AI Model metrics and experimentation framework
• Familiarity in at least one of the prominent cloud providers (Azure, AWS, GCP) and working knowledge of auto ML solutions (Sage Maker, Azure ML etc.
• At least one tool in each category
• Programming language - Python (Must have), (R Or SAS OR PySpark), SQL (Must have)
• Data Visualization (Tableau, QlikView, Power BI, Streamlit) ,
• Data management (using Alteryx, MS Access, or any RDBMS)
• ML Deployment tools (Airflow, MLflow Luigi, Docker etc.)
• RAG - VectorDB (ChromaDB, FAISS, Pinecone)
• Data warehouse solutions (Teradata, Azure SQL DW/Synapse, Redshift, BigQuery etc,)
• Version Control (Git/Github/Git Lab)
• MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
• Coding IDE (VS Code/PyCharm)
• GenAI tools (OpenAI, Google PaLM/BERT, Hugging Face, etc.)

Functional Skills:
• Expertise in building GenAI solutions and delivering tangible business value for clients
• Exposure to Responsible AI framework or AI governance
• Communicating with confidence and ease: You will be a clear and confident communicator, able to deliver messages in a concise manner with strong and effective written and verbal communication.

What You'll Bring
• Bachelor/Master's degree in a field linked to business analytics, statistics or economics, operations research, applied mathematics, computer science, engineering, or related field required advanced degree preferred
• At least 2-4 years of relevant industry work experience providing analytics solutions in a commercial setting
• Prior work experience in a global organization, preferably in a professional services organization in data analytics role
• Demonstrated depth in one or more industries not limited to but including Retail, CPG, Healthcare, Telco etc

#BCGXjob#LI-ND1

Who You'll Work With

You will report to the Lead analyst in X Delivery , and you will work with the larger team on project delivery.

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
BCG is an E - Verify Employer. for more information on E-Verify.

title: Sales Data Analyst
description:
As a Business Analyst with 2 - 5 years of relevant experience, you will be responsible for handling financial data and databases, drawing insights from data, and delivering actionable outputs for stakeholders. Your role will involve working with various financial platforms to extract, manage, and analyze financial data in different forms. You should possess strong analytical and technical skills to translate complex datasets into meaningful reports and insights for the firm, clients, and stakeholders.

- Proficiency in working with financial databases and platforms like Bloomberg, ACE Equity, Capitalline, eVestment, Preqin, Morningstar, and others is required.
- Strong data analytics capabilities including mining, interpretation, and presentation are essential.
- Technical proficiency in database management and optimization is necessary.
- Proficiency in MS Office, especially Excel and PowerPoint, is a must.
- Goal-driven, process-oriented, and self-motivated individuals are preferred.
- Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, are crucial.
- A clean track record on matters of ethics and integrity is expected.

Key Responsibilities:
- Work with databases and platforms to extract, manage, and analyze financial data.
- Design, develop, and maintain databases for efficient data mining and report generation.
- Create, manage, and optimize databases to support data analysis.
- Translate complex datasets into actionable insights and meaningful reports.
- Conduct thorough data analysis to support business decision-making and financial strategies.
- Create dashboards, presentations, and reports using MS Excel and PowerPoint.
- Identify, troubleshoot, and resolve database-related issues efficiently.
- Ensure data quality, integrity, and consistency across various sources and platforms.
- Uphold ethical standards and demonstrate integrity in handling sensitive financial information.

If you are interested in this position, please share your CV at radhika.bhonsle@aptita.com. title: Lead Data Analyst
description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Content Operations Team. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a high-impact team that shapes the quality and structure of content powering our customer-facing platforms. You’ll play a critical role in identifying, evaluating, and onboarding external content sources into our systems, as well as continuously improving the structure, completeness, and relevance of existing content.

Your work will ensure we deliver accurate, timely, and high-value content to end users across various applications. You’ll collaborate closely with our Solution Analysis and Content Technology teams and interface with global stakeholders. We're looking for a data-driven professional with a strong analytical mindset, excellent communication skills, and the technical proficiency to translate insights into actions.

About You – Experience, Education, Skills, and Accomplishments:
• Minimum 5 years of experience as Data Analyst, or similar data-focused role
• Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Data Analytics, or a related field
• Experience with AWS services (e.g., S3, Athena)
• Strong with Excel, SQL skills, preferably PostgreSQL
• Familiarity with data quality metrics and frameworks
• Metadata analysis and taxonomy/ontology understanding
• Experience with data modeling and structured/unstructured data
• Strong data wrangling and exploration experience

It Would Be Great if You Also Had:
• Experience with Databricks, or similar data platforms
• Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI)
• Exposure to API integration and working with JSON/XML data

What You’ll Be Doing in This Role:
• Evaluate and analyze external content sources for relevance, quality, structure, and usability
• Perform data quality assessments and help design data profiling frameworks
• Collaborate with product managers, data engineers, and content specialists to onboard new content sources
• Create reports, dashboards, and documentation to share findings and support decisions
• Improve existing content through structured analysis and feedback loops
• Translate technical findings into business-friendly presentations for non-technical stakeholders
• Support automation efforts for content transformation and integration
• Participate in continuous improvement of content ingestion processes and validation workflows
• Ensure compliance with data usage policies and content governance standards

About the Team:

The Content Operations Team is at the heart of how we deliver structured, high-quality content to our global customers. Our team partners with engineering, product, and business teams worldwide to manage the end-to-end lifecycle of content from sourcing and evaluation to integration and enhancement. We value collaboration, innovation, and accountability. We work in a fast-paced, supportive environment where your contributions have real impact on products used by thousands of customers.

At Clarivate, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all qualified persons with respect to hiring, compensation, promotion, training, and other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment. We comply with applicable laws and regulations governing non-discrimination in all locations.

title: Data Analyst-Application Development-Data Visualization
description: Analyze and interpret large datasets to extract meaningful insights and support decision-making processes in the business.

title: Junior Data Analyst
description:
Database Report Labs is a premier data analytics consulting firm specialising in data reporting, data engineering, business intelligence, and digital analytics. With a global footprint across the US, Europe, and India, we work with many clients—from fast-growing startups to Fortune 500 companies like Apple, Microsoft, Google, Netflix, H&M, and BCG. We use a modern data stack to build custom data pipelines, dashboards, and analytical solutions, including tools such as dbt, BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake, Metabase, and more. We are a fully remote company!

We are hiring a Data Analyst who can start immediately. The candidate should be proficient in writing advanced SQL queries, conducting in-depth data analysis, and have some business domain knowledge. Degrees don't matter to us; eagerness to work does!

Core Responsibilities:
Data Collection and Cleaning: Source data from multiple platforms and ensure it is accurate, complete, and structured for analysis. Data Analysis and Interpretation: Perform complex SQL queries across databases and use statistical techniques to extract meaningful insights. Data Visualisation: Develop clear and informative dashboards and reports using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker. Business Insight Generation: Translate business problems into data queries and provide actionable insights to guide decision-making. Reporting and Communication: Present findings to stakeholders clearly and concisely.

Candidate Requirements:
Must be currently based in India. Able to join within a week. Comfortable working in a hybrid Indian and US time zone schedule. Proficiency in SQL, data modelling, and familiarity with at least one BI tool such as Tableau, Power BI, Metabase, Looker Studio, or Domo are highly desirable. Knowledge of Statistics and KPIs is an added advantage. Should be able to clear 2–3 rounds of interviews. He/she should not be a data science, machine learning, or AI aspirant.

If you're interested or have additional questions, reach out directly to Shubhashish Dixit via and explain why you'd be a strong fit for the role. We don't love reading CVs as they are partially true.

This role is not open to freshers. If you have no prior experience, please consider our internship program instead, which does not involve SQL-based assignments. We don't want AI letters.

#PS: Type the colors of the indian flag other than white in caps when you start your application.

description:
Hello Connections!

title: Data Analyst Training Internship
description:
As an aspiring Data Analyst, you have the opportunity to participate in our 6-month remote Data Analyst Training Internship. This program is tailored to enhance your skills in data interpretation, visualization, and decision-making under the guidance of industry experts. Through live classes and interactive sessions, you will work on real datasets to gain practical experience.

Key Responsibilities:
- Analyze large datasets to identify patterns, trends, and actionable insights.
- Create interactive dashboards and reports using tools such as Excel, Tableau, and Power BI.
- Utilize SQL for data querying, management, and extraction.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to establish key performance indicators and implement data-driven solutions.
- Clean, transform, and prepare raw data for analysis.
- Provide data-supported recommendations to contribute to strategic decision-making.

Qualifications:
- Hold a Bachelors degree or equivalent (graduates from 2019 onward are eligible).
- Demonstrate a strong interest in data analysis.
- Possess basic knowledge of Excel with a willingness to learn SQL, Tableau, and Power BI.
- Exhibit a strong analytical mindset with attention to detail.
- Show enthusiasm for working with numbers and interpreting data.

In addition to the above responsibilities and qualifications, you will benefit from:
- Live Training: Engage in live classes and interactive sessions led by data professionals.
- Practical Skills: Acquire hands-on experience in SQL, Tableau, Excel, and Power BI.
- Real-World Projects: Work on actual datasets to develop a job-ready portfolio.
- Mentorship: Receive personalized guidance and feedback from experienced mentors.
- Certification: Obtain a recognized certificate upon successful completion of the internship.

Join our internship program to:
- Learn directly from experts through live courses and interactive sessions.
- Enhance your portfolio with real-world projects and datasets.
- Develop job-ready skills in data analysis and visualization.
- Participate in a completely free internship program designed to kickstart your career in data analytics.

Apply Now to kickstart your journey in data analytics and gain the necessary skills and confidence to excel in the data-driven world. We offer Full-time, Part-time, and Internship job types with an expected commitment of 15 hours per week during the Day shift schedule.,

title: Data and Analytics
description:
A Data and Machine Learning Specialist is responsible for managing, analyzing, and leveraging data to drive business insights and develop predictive models. This role combines elements of data science, data engineering, data management, and machine learning to ensure data-driven decision-making and innovation.

Responsibilities:
• Data Collection & Management: Gather, clean, and organize data from various sources to ensure its accuracy and accessibility.
• Data Analysis: Utilize statistical methods and machine learning tools to analyze data and uncover trends and patterns.
• Pipeline Development: Design and maintain efficient data pipelines and architectures to facilitate seamless data flow.
• Model Development: Create, test, and optimize machine learning models and algorithms to solve complex problems.
• Reporting & Visualization: Present findings through detailed reports and visualizations to communicate insights effectively.
• Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including software engineers, data scientists, and business analysts, to implement data-driven solutions.
• Performance Optimization: Continuously improve data delivery, scalability, and model performance.
• Documentation: Maintain thorough documentation of processes, models, and results.

Requirements:
• Bachelors or equivalent degree with over 5+ years of experience and proficiency in programming languages such as Python, SQL.
• Strong knowledge of cloud platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, or Microsoft Azure.
• Experience with data visualization tools and techniques.
• Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms and statistical analysis.
• Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
• Ability to collaborate effectively with diverse teams.

At KONE, we are focused on creating an innovative and collaborative working culture where we value the contribution of each individual. Employee engagement is a key focus area for us and we encourage participation and the sharing of information and ideas. Sustainability is an integral part of our culture and the daily practice. We follow ethical business practices and we seek to develop a culture of working together where co-workers trust and respect each other and good performance is recognized. In being a great place to work, we are proud to offer a range of experiences and opportunities that will help you to achieve your career and personal goals and enable you to live a healthy and balanced life.

Read more on www.kone.com/careers

title: Senior Data Analytics Engineer
description: Job Details: Job Description: This role is an exciting opportunity to apply AI/data technology to translate manufacturing data into meaningful insights to help solve factory yield/process engineering problems. title: Data Scientist / Data Analyst
description:
A data scientists job is to analyze data, extract insights, and build predictive models that help organizations make smarter decisions and solve difficult problems. By blending expertise in statistics, computer science, and business strategy, they not only analyze complex datasets but also build predictive models that improve operations and shape long-term decisions

Key Responsibilities of a Data Scientist

So, what are the responsibilities of a data scientist They include:
• Data Collection and Preparation: Bringing together information from different sources, cleaning it, and making sure its ready for analysis
• Exploratory Data Analysis: Examining large datasets, both structured and unstructured, to spot patterns, trends, and unusual findings
• Model Building and Evaluation: Creating machine learning models and algorithms, then testing them to ensure accuracy and effectiveness
• Predictive Modeling: Using statistical methods to build models that can forecast outcomes and support better planning
• Automation and AI Integration: Simplifying tasks and processes through programming and AI tools
• Data Visualization: Turning results into clear reports, dashboards, and visualizations that make insights easy to understand
• Communication and Collaboration: Working closely with different teams to make sure data-driven insights are put into action
• Continuous Learning: Keeping skills up to date by exploring new tools, technologies, and approaches in data science

title: Data Analyst Jobs in India – Fresher Friendly – Hybrid Model
description:
Job Summary

Progressive Technology is hiring entry-level Data Analysts who are passionate about turning raw data into actionable insights. This is a fresher-friendly role with a structured onboarding plan, mentorship, and hands-on project exposure. You will learn to collect, clean, analyze, visualize, and present data to help business teams make informed decisions across marketing, product, operations, and finance. If you are comfortable with numbers, curious by nature, and eager to grow in analytics, we want to meet you.
Key Responsibilities
• *

Ingest, clean, and prepare large datasets from multiple sources (CSV, databases, APIs) for analysis.
• *

Build dashboards and reports in Power BI/Tableau/Google Data Studio to track KPIs and business trends.
• *

Write basic to intermediate SQL queries to extract and manipulate data.
• *

Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) using Excel and Python/R to discover patterns, anomalies, and opportunities.
• *

Create clear visualizations and executive-ready presentations that tell a compelling data story.
• *

Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Product, Marketing, Operations) to translate business questions into analytical problems.
• *

Document data definitions, business logic, and analytical methodologies for reproducibility.
• *

Support A/B tests, cohort analysis, and funnel analysis under guidance from senior analysts.
• *

Adhere to data governance, privacy, and security best practices.
• *

Continuously learn new tools, libraries, and analytical techniques through internal training and self-study.
• Required Skills and Qualifications
• *

Bachelors degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Commerce, or related fields.
• *

Strong foundation in Excel/Google Sheets (lookups, pivots, charts, basic formulas).
• *

Working knowledge of SQL (SELECT, JOINs, GROUP BY, basic window functions preferred).
• *

Familiarity with at least one programming language for data work: Python (pandas, NumPy) or R.
• *

Understanding of basic statistical concepts: mean/median, correlation, hypothesis testing, distributions.
• *

Basic experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, or equivalent) — academic or project exposure is acceptable.
• *

Clear communication skills—ability to turn numbers into narratives for non-technical stakeholders.
• *

Strong attention to detail, data accuracy, and documentation discipline.
• Experience
• *

0–2 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or analytics internships/projects.
• *

Final-year students or recent graduates with strong academic or project portfolios are encouraged to apply.
• *

GitHub/portfolio/Kaggle projects, hackathons, or relevant certifications (e.g., Google Data Analytics, Microsoft Power BI) are a plus.
• Working Hours
• *

Standard business hours: 9:30 AM – 6:30 PM IST, Monday to Friday.
• *

Flexibility to support critical deliverables or stakeholder meetings when required.
• *

Hybrid model: typically 2–3 days in-office per week (may vary by team/city).
• Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities (KSAs)

Knowledge
• *

Basics of relational databases, data warehousing concepts, and ETL/ELT workflows.
• *

Introductory statistical modeling (regression, clustering) is a plus.
• *

Understanding of business metrics such as CAC, LTV, churn, conversion rates, and revenue funnels (nice to have).
• Skills
• *

Data wrangling, visualization, and storytelling.
• *

Requirement gathering and translating ambiguous business problems into structured analysis.
• *

Version control (Git) familiarity is advantageous.
• Abilities
• *

Learn fast, ask the right questions, and operate with a growth mindset.
• *

Manage multiple tasks with tight deadlines while maintaining data quality.
• *

Work collaboratively in a hybrid environment with distributed teams.
• Benefits
• *

Fresher-focused onboarding with a dedicated mentor and a 6–8 week learning path.
• *

Access to paid certifications, courses, and internal learning labs.
• *

Competitive compensation with performance-based increments and bonuses.
• *

Comprehensive health insurance and wellness benefits.
• *

Hybrid work flexibility and modern collaboration stack.
• *

Accelerated career path into Senior Data Analyst, BI Developer, Product Analyst, or Data Scientist roles.
• Why Join Progressive Technology
• *

Work on real business problems from Day 1 with high visibility on impact.
• *

A culture that values learning, curiosity, and experimentation.
• *

Opportunity to own dashboards, metrics, and mini-projects early in your career.
• *

Supportive leadership, flat communication, and transparent feedback loops.
• *

Modern tech stack, data-first decision-making, and continuous upskilling.
• How to Apply
• Submit your resume (PDF) highlighting relevant academic projects, internships, or certifications.
• *

Include a brief cover note (150–200 words) explaining why you want to start your analytics career with us.
• *

(Optional but preferred) Share links to GitHub/Kaggle/portfolio dashboards.
• *

Shortlisted candidates will go through:
• *

Aptitude & SQL/Excel Online Assessment
• *

Case Study / Data Challenge
• *

Technical Interview with Analytics Team
• *

HR & Culture Fit Discussion
• *
• Apply via our careers page or email your application to us with the subject line:
Application – Data Analyst (Fresher)

title: Junior Data Analyst Apprentice
description:
Our client is offering an exciting opportunity for a motivated and eager Junior Data Analyst Apprentice to join their team in **Ahmedabad, Gujarat, IN**. This apprenticeship program is designed to provide hands-on training and practical experience in the field of data analysis. As an apprentice, you will work closely with senior analysts to learn how to collect, clean, analyze, and interpret complex datasets. You will gain exposure to various analytical tools and techniques, contributing to data-driven decision-making processes within the organization. This is an on-site role, offering invaluable mentorship and direct interaction with the data analytics team.

Apprenticeship Responsibilities:
Assist senior analysts in data collection, extraction, and organization from various sources. Learn to clean and preprocess data, identifying and resolving inconsistencies and errors. Support the analysis of data to identify trends, patterns, and insights. Help create reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate findings effectively. Gain proficiency in using data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, and basic Python/R libraries. Participate in team meetings and contribute to discussions on data-related projects. Learn about data governance, data quality, and best practices in data management. Shadow experienced data analysts to understand their workflow and problem-solving approaches. Assist in documenting analytical processes and findings. Support the development of simple predictive models or statistical analyses under guidance. Understand the business context and how data analysis contributes to strategic goals. Requirements:
Recent graduate with a Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related quantitative field. Strong analytical and critical thinking skills. A keen interest in data analysis and interpretation. Basic understanding of statistical concepts. Familiarity with spreadsheet software (e.g., Microsoft Excel) is essential. Basic knowledge of SQL or other database querying languages is a plus. Eagerness to learn and a proactive attitude towards skill development. Good written and verbal communication skills. Ability to work collaboratively within a team environment. Must be based in or willing to relocate to **Ahmedabad, Gujarat, IN** for the duration of the apprenticeship. This apprenticeship is suitable for individuals seeking to build a career in data analytics. This program is an excellent stepping stone for aspiring data professionals. If you are a detail-oriented individual with a passion for uncovering insights from data, this apprenticeship in **Ahmedabad, Gujarat, IN** is the perfect start to your career.

title: Data Analyst | Finance Platform Solutions
description:
Join our dynamic Finance Platform Solutions team delivering system support and change governance. This is an exciting opportunity working in a collaborative and dynamic culture where you will act as an intermediary between the Financial Management Group and Technology teams.

At Macquarie, our advantage is bringing together diverse people and empowering them to shape all kinds of possibilities. We are a global financial services group operating in 31 markets and with 56 years of unbroken profitability. You’ll be part of a friendly and supportive team where everyone - no matter what role - contributes ideas and drives outcomes.

What role will you play?

In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analytics and modern tools to design and maintain automated solutions that meet business needs. You will develop SQL queries, support Power BI dashboards, and ensure data integrity while troubleshooting and resolving issues. Additionally, you will lead transformation projects, collaborating with various stakeholders to translate business requirements into analytical solutions.

What You Offer
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field, with 5+ years of experience in data analytics, Power BI, and SQL
• Expertise in Alteryx, DBMS, data lake architectures, and familiarity with distributed query engines like Starburst is preferred
• Experience with financial reporting tools such as Workiva is advantageous
• Proven ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions aligned with organizational goals
• Strong analytical skills, problem-solving mindset, and a commitment to delivering high-quality, innovative data projects

We love hearing from anyone inspired to build a better future with us, if you're excited about the role or working at Macquarie we encourage you to apply.

What We Offer

Benefits

At Macquarie, you’re empowered to shape a career that’s rewarding in all the ways that matter most to you. Macquarie employees can access a wide range of benefits which, depending on eligibility criteria, include:
• 1 wellbeing leave day per year
• 26 weeks’ paid maternity leave or 20 weeks’ paid parental leave for primary caregivers along with 12 days of paid transition leave upon return to work and 6 weeks’ paid leave for secondary caregivers
• Company-subsidised childcare services
• 2 days of paid volunteer leave and donation matching
• Benefits to support your physical, mental and financial wellbeing including comprehensive medical and life insurance cover, the option to join parental medical insurance plan and virtual medical consultations extended to family members
• Access to our Employee Assistance Program, a robust behavioural health network with counselling and coaching services
• Access to a wide range of learning and development opportunities, including reimbursement for professional membership or subscription
• Hybrid and flexible working arrangements, dependent on role
• Reimbursement for work from home equipment

About Financial Management, People and Engagement

Financial Management, People and Engagement (FPE) provides a single interface for Macquarie’s businesses across key areas of people, strategy, communications and financial management. Comprising two pillars – Financial Management, and People and Engagement – it is responsible for managing the Group’s financial, tax and treasury activities and strategic priorities, fostering our culture through people and community engagement strategies, and engaging with stakeholders to protect and promote Macquarie’s reputation globally.

Our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion

We are committed to fostering a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and welcome all identities, including race, ethnicity, cultural identity, nationality, gender (including gender identity or expression), age, sexual orientation, marital or partnership status, parental, caregiving or family status, neurodiversity, religion or belief, disability, or socio-economic background. We welcome further discussions on how you can feel included and belong at Macquarie as you progress through our recruitment process.

Our aim is to provide reasonable adjustments to individuals who may need support during the recruitment process and through working arrangements. If you require additional assistance, please let us know in the application process.
