title: Data Analyst – Zyphra Tech | Hyderabad, Telangana, India
description:
Location: Hyderabad, Telangana, India
Job Type: Full-Time / Internship (with potential for full-time opportunity)
Company: Zyphra Tech

About Zyphra Tech

Zyphra Tech is a leading technology and analytics solutions company that helps businesses unlock the true potential of their data. We specialize in transforming raw information into actionable insights through cutting-edge tools, advanced analytics, and innovative data-driven strategies.

Our team combines technical expertise with business intelligence to solve complex challenges across industries such as e-commerce, finance, healthcare, and technology. At Zyphra Tech, we believe in empowering young professionals with real-world experience to help them grow into confident and capable data professionals.

If you’re passionate about data, analytics, and technology — and you’re eager to make an impact — this is the perfect opportunity to start your career as a Data Analyst.

About the Role

As a Data Analyst at Zyphra Tech, you will work closely with our Analytics and Business Intelligence team to collect, clean, analyse, and interpret data that supports strategic business decisions.

This role is ideal for candidates who are enthusiastic about learning, love solving analytical problems, and want to gain hands-on experience with modern data tools and methodologies. You’ll be part of a fast-paced environment where data drives every decision, and your work will directly influence the company’s growth and performance.

Key Responsibilities
• Data Collection & Cleaning: Assist in gathering and cleaning data from various internal and external sources to ensure accuracy and completeness.
• Data Analysis: Analyse large datasets to identify patterns, trends, and insights that contribute to business improvement and innovation.
• Reporting & Dashboards: Create and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs) using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Excel.
• Visualisation: Prepare visually compelling data visualisations and presentations for management and stakeholders.
• Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work with different teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions.
• Data Integrity: Ensure consistency, reliability, and accuracy across all analytics and reporting systems.
• Automation: Support automation of data collection, processing, and reporting workflows to improve efficiency.
• Continuous Improvement: Contribute to refining internal data analysis processes and analytics methodologies.

Qualifications & Skills

To succeed as a Data Analyst at Zyphra Tech, you should have a strong analytical mindset, attention to detail, and a passion for working with data.

Preferred qualifications include:
• Currently pursuing or recently completed a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics, or a related discipline.
• Solid analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Proficiency in MS Excel (advanced functions, pivot tables, charts).
• Basic knowledge of data visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
• Familiarity with SQL, Python, or R for data manipulation and analysis is a plus.
• Strong communication skills with the ability to present findings clearly.
• Ability to handle large datasets with accuracy and consistency.
• A proactive attitude and eagerness to learn in a fast-paced, data-driven environment.

What You’ll Learn

At Zyphra Tech, learning never stops. As a Data Analyst, you’ll gain hands-on experience across the full data analytics lifecycle — from data collection to storytelling with insights.

You’ll learn:
• End-to-End Data Analysis: Understanding the entire workflow from data sourcing to visualisation.
• Data Cleaning & Transformation: Techniques to handle missing data, inconsistencies, and validation.
• Modern Analytics Tools: Hands-on experience with Excel, Power BI, SQL, and Python.
• Business Insights: How to turn data findings into actionable recommendations that drive growth.
• Reporting & Presentation: Learn how to communicate insights effectively through visuals and dashboards.
• Industry Best Practices: Exposure to real-world business problems and analytics methodologies.

Why Join Zyphra Tech?
• Work with a passionate team of analysts, data engineers, and business professionals.
• Gain practical experience with real-world business datasets.
• Enhance your resume with cutting-edge tools and analytics exposure.
• Receive mentorship from industry experts.
• Potential for a full-time role based on performance.

How to Apply

If you’re ready to kickstart your career in data analytics and make a meaningful contribution, we’d love to hear from you!

📩 Apply Now: Submit your resume and a brief cover letter highlighting your interest in data analytics.

title: Senior Data Analyst - Digital Finance
description:
In the role of Senior Manager, Data Analytics at Novartis, you will be responsible for managing and analyzing large volumes of data to extract valuable insights. Your exceptional analytical skills will be utilized to manipulate and interpret complex datasets using various technologies, including programming languages. You will also play a crucial role in fostering strong relationships with global stakeholders and effectively communicating business analyst needs to data engineers or software engineers.

Key Responsibilities:
- Utilize statistical techniques and data mining methods to analyze large datasets, identify trends, patterns, and correlations to uncover valuable insights
- Thoroughly clean, validate, and organize data to ensure accuracy and consistency, resolving data quality issues to maintain data integrity
- Present findings through clear and concise data visualizations, enabling easy understanding and interpretation
- Conduct ad-hoc data analysis to provide actionable recommendations to stakeholders and support decision-making processes
- Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to understand requirements and provide data-driven solutions, fostering effective teamwork and communication
- Generate insights from data and communicate them to key stakeholders, both technical and non-technical
- Develop and maintain documentation related to data analysis processes and procedures for knowledge sharing
- Stay updated with the latest trends and techniques in data analytics, continuously exploring and implementing new tools and technologies

Qualifications Required:
- Strong analytical skills with the ability to manipulate and interpret large datasets, knowledge of statistical techniques and data mining algorithms
- Proficiency in programming languages, such as Python, and strong SQL skills with an aptitude for learning other analytics tools
- Experience with BI tools like PowerBI or Qlik, ETL tools like Dataiku/Alteryx, and effective communication skills for presenting findings to stakeholders

Desirable Qualifications:
- 5+ years of extensive experience in Data and/or Business Analytics, with a background in Financial Data Analytics being an added advantage
- Bachelors or Masters degree in a relevant field such as mathematics, statistics, economics, or computer science
- Strong written and verbal communication skills

About Novartis:
Novartis is dedicated to helping people with diseases and their families through innovative science and a community of smart, passionate individuals. By collaborating, supporting, and inspiring each other, we aim to achieve breakthroughs that change patients" lives. If you are ready to create a brighter future together, join us at Novartis.

[Note: Additional details about the company have been omitted from this job description]

If you are interested in this role or want to explore other career opportunities at Novartis, you can join our talent community to stay connected and learn about suitable roles as soon as they become available. Novartis is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you require such accommodations during the recruitment process, please reach out to [email protected] with your request and contact information. Novartis is dedicated to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment with diverse teams that represent the patients and communities we serve.,

title: Data Analytics Analyst
description:
You will be responsible for building and maintaining HR dashboards and metrics to track key performance indicators. Additionally, you will collaborate with HR business partners, talent acquisition, compensation and benefits teams, and other stakeholders to understand their analytical needs and provide customized dashboards and insights. It will be your duty to stay updated with the latest HR analytics trends, tools, and technologies, and recommend innovative solutions to enhance HR data Analyst capabilities. You will also provide training and guidance to HR team members on data techniques and tools, ensuring data accuracy, integrity, and security in all HR analytics processes and systems. Furthermore, you will present findings, insights, and recommendations to senior management and key stakeholders in a clear and concise manner. Your tasks will involve collecting, analyzing, and interpreting HR data from multiple sources to identify trends, patterns, and correlations, providing insights and recommendations for HR initiatives and strategies.

Qualifications Required:
- 2-4 years of relevant experience.
- Bachelors degree in human resources, statistics, business administration, or a related field experience preferred.
- Proven previous Workday experience.
- Proficiency in statistical analysis, data mining, and data visualization tools (e.g., Workday, Excel, Tableau, Power BI, etc.).
- Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
- Effective communication and presentation skills.
- Ability to work independently, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and meet tight deadlines.
- Attention to detail and a high level of data accuracy and integrity.
- Experienced Workday superuser with deep understanding of people analytics and PRISM modules.
- Ability to move quickly from big picture thinking to managing relevant detail.
- Demonstrated desire to challenge the status quo and drive the team to new ways of thinking and processes.
- Passion for the restaurant industry and excitement for learning about restaurant operations.
- Strong communicator who can work collaboratively across the enterprise and effectively manage expectations across distributed stakeholders.
- Maintain flexibility and influence others to do the same.

title: Senior Business Unit Data Analyst (4+ Years in Writing Store Procedures + Solid Exp in SQL + Stakeholder Management Skill)
description:
Sr. Business Unit Data Analyst, Assurant-GCC, India

This role supports data quality, validation, and process monitoring across the SSP platform. The individual will help ensure data is accurate, consistently understood, and reflective of the business processes it represents. Working across multiple domains, the role is responsible for identifying and analyzing data discrepancies, contributing to the development of data definitions, and supporting the implementation of business controls to detect issues early. The position also collaborates with internal stakeholders and clients to clarify data meaning, support control needs, and help maintain the integrity of SSP’s shared platform environment.

This position requires strong SQL, analytical and computer skills, attention to detail, a positive professional attitude, the ability to work in a team environment, and, from time to time or as business dictates, longer work weeks and extended hours.

This position will be in Bengaluru, Chennai, Hyderabad at our India location.

The Working Timing will be 3:30 PM IST – 12:30 AM IST.

What will be my duties and responsibilities in this job?
• Develop and Maintain the Data Definition Layer: Using SQL and write stored procedures to help build and manage a structured Data Definition Layer that clarifies the meaning, use, and expected behavior of key SSP data elements across domains.
• Drive Data Quality and Integrity: Analyze SSP data and write SQL stored procedures to proactively identify inconsistencies, anomalies, and gaps that could impact operational accuracy, client deliverables, or platform health.
• Validate System Behavior Through Data: Write SQL Stored Procedures to trace how SSP processes and decisions are reflected in the data, confirming that the system is operating as intended and escalating discrepancies for investigation or correction.
• Design, Implement, and Oversee Data Controls: Write SQL stored procedures to create business controls that monitor key processes, detect systemic issues early, and trigger alerts for operational review and correction. Provide ongoing oversight to ensure controls stay effective as SSP evolves.
• Collaborate with Business and Technical Teams: Partner with Product Owners, Operations, and Technology teams to ensure a common understanding of SSP data. Proactively engage with Product Owners to assess data-related impacts of upcoming changes and mitigate potential risks before deployment.
• Monitor Platform Health and Mitigate Risk: Continuously monitor SSP data and controls to identify systemic issues early, prevent widespread impacts across the shared platform, and reduce operational and client risk.
• Support Root Cause Analysis and Continuous Improvement: Investigate the root causes of data issues, recommend enhancements to processes or system logic, and strengthen overall data validation and control frameworks.
• Document Known Data Behaviors and Issues: Maintain comprehensive documentation of validated data behaviors, known data quality issues, and special conditions to make data use across SSP consistent and transparent.
• Support Strategic Data Initiatives: Participate in larger initiatives aimed at improving SSP’s data infrastructure, building proactive quality monitoring, enhancing alerting systems, and expanding operational visibility.
• Collaborate with Clients on SSP Data Needs: Partner with clients who request specific SSP data for their internal controls or risk monitoring needs, ensuring data definitions are clearly understood and consistently applied, while working closely with internal teams to maintain data quality and protect platform standards.

What are the requirements needed for this position?

Overall 4+ Years of Work Experience
• Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, Information Technology, Data Analytics or related field preferred or equivalent work experience
• Strong analytical skills, with 3-4 years of experience that include analyzing data or building data models to support reporting and/or analytics.
• Strong working knowledge of the Office suite (Excel, Word, Access, PowerPoint, SharePoint)
• Excellent verbal and written communications skills
• Strong presentation skills, to include presentation construction and design and presentation delivery
• Ability (and preference) to work in an agile environment.
• Must be willing to work extended hours when necessary to achieve objectives and goals

What are the Preferred Skills required for this position?
• Individual contributor with leadership skills to drive actions
• Strong skills in developing transactional SQL procedures to populate data tables. Experience working in a large table environment is a plus.
• Knowledge of data models and query tools
• Ability to create information out of raw data
• Ability to write Data Definition Language or Data Manipulation Language SQL commands
• Ability to improve data quality and design or present conclusions gained from analyzing data Passion for connecting the dots (Data to the Bottom line)
• Prior experience developing SQL procedures in Operations or Finance domain is a plus
• Ability to analyze problems and provide recommendations
• Ability to collaborate within and outside of the team
• Ability to deliver results with minimum supervision
• Ability to think innovatively
• Power BI experience a plus
• Strong critical thinking skills
• High degree of curiosity. desire to learn and loves to get into the detail
• Strong communication skills - written and verbal
• Making sound decisions with minimal supervision
• using statistical tools like Microsoft Excel, SAS, SPSS and others
• Ability to create process/work flows
• 2+ years' experience in Insurance Tracking is preferred

title: Data Analyst II
description:
As a Data Analyst at TechnipFMC in Hyderabad, IN, you will play a crucial lead role in managing and optimizing business intelligence solutions using Power BI. You will have the opportunity to lead the design, development, and deployment of Power BI reports and dashboards, providing strategic direction for data visualization and business intelligence initiatives.

Your responsibilities will include:
- Leading the design, development, and deployment of Power BI reports and dashboards
- Providing strategic direction for data visualization and business intelligence initiatives
- Interfacing with Business Owner, Project Manager, Planning Manager, Resource Managers, etc.
- Developing a roadmap for the execution of complex data analytics projects
- Developing complex data models, establishing relationships, and ensuring data integrity
- Performing advanced data analysis using DAX and other analytical tools to derive insights
- Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and define data needs
- Ensuring the delivery of high-quality BI solutions
- Optimizing solutions for performance and efficiency
- Mentoring and guiding junior developers in Power BI development
- Implementing and maintaining data security measures

To excel in this role, you should have:
- Educational Background: Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field
- Experience in working with unstructured data and data integration
- Technical Skills: Proficiency in Power BI, DAX, SQL, data modeling, and exposure to data engineering
- Hands-on experience with Snowflake
- 7-8 years of experience in business intelligence and data analytics, with a focus on Power BI
- Soft Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, excellent communication abilities, and the capacity to lead and collaborate with global cross-functional teams

TechnipFMC is committed to driving real change in the energy industry and values diversity, inclusion, and authenticity in its workforce. Join us in building a sustainable future through relentless innovation and global collaboration. TechnipFMC respects the rights and dignity of those it works with and promotes adherence to internationally recognized human rights principles for those in its value chain.,

title: MDM Data Analyst
description:
As an MDM Data Analyst in this long-term remote contract role based in Hyderabad, your role involves managing and analyzing master data sets, developing and maintaining data models, and ensuring data accuracy and consistency. You will also support data-related initiatives, identify trends, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance data quality and reporting capabilities.

Key Responsibilities:
- Manage and analyze master data sets effectively
- Develop and maintain data models to support organizational needs
- Ensure data accuracy and consistency throughout the organization
- Support data-related initiatives and identify trends
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance data quality and reporting capabilities

Qualifications Required:
- Strong analytical skills and statistical abilities to interpret and analyze data effectively
- Expertise in data analytics, including proficiency with tools and technologies for data processing and visualization
- Proficiency in data modeling techniques and practices to support data structures and ensure data integrity
- Excellent communication skills to present findings and collaborate with cross-functional teams
- Familiarity with Master Data Management (MDM) systems and related tools is highly desirable
- Detail-oriented with problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude
- Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field

This role offers a great opportunity for a skilled MDM Data Analyst to work remotely on a long-term contract basis, contributing to the success of data-related initiatives and ensuring data accuracy and consistency within the organization.,

title: Associate Data Analyst (New Graduate, Thai Speaking) (Marketing Analytics, Bangkok Based)
description:
About Agoda

At Agoda, we bridge the world through travel. Our story began in 2005, when two lifelong friends and entrepreneurs, driven by their passion for travel, launched Agoda to make it easier for everyone to explore the world.

Today, we are part of Booking Holdings [NASDAQ: BKNG], with a diverse team of over 7,000 people from 90 countries, working together in offices around the globe. Every day, we connect people to destinations and experiences, with our great deals across our millions of hotels and holiday properties, flights, and experiences worldwide.

No two days are the same at Agoda. Data and technology are at the heart of our culture, fueling our curiosity and innovation. If you’re ready to begin your best journey and help build travel for the world, join us.

Get to Know our Team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda have deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

In this Role, you’ll get to:
• Search: Experiment with text ads, bidding, and campaign structures on Google, Bing, Baidu, Naver, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests.
• Display: Test, analyze, and optimize campaigns on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and others.
• Modeling: Analyze the vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop models we can use for optimization, and build dashboards for account managers.

What you’ll Need to Succeed:
• Bachelor’s Degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject (computer science, mathematics, economics, engineering, statistics or science)
• Fresh graduation are welcome (0-1 years of experience)
• Ability to communicate fluently in English
• Basic business acumen
• Proficient in statistics and Excel
• Exposure to data tools (SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA, SQL, Tableau)
• Familiar with A/B testing concepts
• Works under close supervision and supports projects with guidance

It’s Great if you Have:
• Experience in digital marketing
• Academic research experience

title: Data Analyst Level 1
description:
Role Overview:
You will play a key role in developing clinical database products in various therapeutic areas such as Metabolic & CV, Neuroscience, Autoimmune, Oncology, Respiratory, etc. Your primary focus will be to ensure the high quality of these products to support Meta-analysis. Additionally, you will be responsible for analyzing and annotating trial design information, treatments, demographics, and outcomes data from clinical literature. Your role will also involve digitizing results from graphs and working closely with the team to understand and contribute to database rules and quality processes.

Key Responsibilities:
- Develop clinical database products with high quality to support Meta-analysis
- Analyze and annotate trial design information, treatments, demographics, and outcomes data from clinical literature
- Digitize results from graphs for outcomes reported on linear, logarithmic, and semi-log scales
- Collaborate with the lead consultant, peer data analyst, and Quality manager to contribute to database rules and quality processes
- Undergo relevant training programs to enhance skills in Statistics, R coding, Systematic literature review, and Data analysis methods

Qualifications:
- Master's in Pharmacology or Pharmaceutics (with relevant experience), PharmaD, Clinical Practice, Master's in Public Health, or Epidemiology
- Minimum 1-2 years of experience in Information science, Systematic Literature review, Health-economics, and public health sectors, pharmaceutical industry experience preferred
- Strong knowledge of Pharmacology and clinical research
- Knowledge of clinical development, post-approval phases, trial designs, Pharma Industry data standards/ontologies
- Knowledge of statistics, data management tools like R is an added advantage

Additional Company Details:
Certara is a leading Clinical Pharmacology & Pharmacometric organization globally, offering various career pathways to match the ambition and personal interests of its employees. The company integrates advanced simulation approaches into critical drug development deliverables to inform decision-making and strengthen global regulatory submissions. With a successful track record and extensive expertise in working on numerous drug development projects, Certara brings value to each assignment.,

title: data analyst intern
description:
Position Overview

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst Intern to join our dynamic team. This is an exciting opportunity for individuals looking to kickstart their career in data analysis within a supportive and innovative environment. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical skills and a passion for data-driven decision-making. This internship will provide hands-on experience in data analysis, allowing you to work on real-world projects that impact our business.

Key Responsibilities
• Assist in collecting, processing, and analyzing data to support business decisions.
• Collaborate with team members to identify trends and insights from data sets.
• Prepare reports and presentations to communicate findings to stakeholders.
• Utilize various data analysis tools and software to enhance data accuracy and efficiency.
• Participate in team meetings and contribute ideas for improving data processes.
• Support the team in maintaining data integrity and quality across various projects.

Qualifications

To be considered for this internship, candidates should meet the following qualifications:
• Strong proficiency in computer skills, including familiarity with data analysis tools.
• Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, to effectively convey data insights.
• A keen interest in data analysis and a willingness to learn and grow in the field.
• Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.
• Strong attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work.

Additional Information

This is a contractual position with an annual salary of 1,00,000. The internship will be based in Hyderabad and Kolkata, offering a hybrid work mode that combines both in-office and remote work. The job schedule will be rotating, providing flexibility in working hours. We have 10 positions available for this internship, and we welcome candidates with 0 years of experience to apply.

If you are eager to gain valuable experience in data analysis and contribute to meaningful projects, we encourage you to apply for the Data Analyst Intern position. Join us in our mission to leverage data for better decision-making and drive business success!

title: Data Analyst / Data Scientist
description:
Job role:

As a data analyst, you will be responsible for compiling actionable insights from data. We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will collect, organize, analyze, and interpret large datasets to support business decision-making and identify trends or opportunities. Your role will involve driving initiatives to optimize for operational excellence and revenue.

Responsibilities:
• Gather, clean, and validate data from various sources (databases, APIs, and third-party tools).
• Maintain and improve data accuracy and integrity.
• Ensure that data flows smoothly from source to destination so that it can be processed
• Utilize strong database skills to work with large, complex data sets to extract insights
• Filter and cleanse unstructured (or ambiguous) data into usable data sets that can be analyzed to extract insights and improve business processes
• Identify new internal and external data sources to support analytics initiatives and work with appropriate partners to absorb the data into new or existing data infrastructure
• Build tools for automating repetitive asks so that bandwidth can be freed for analytics
• Collaborate with program managers and business analysts to help them come up with actionable, high-impact insights across product lines and functions
• Work closely with top management to prioritize information and analytic needs
• Create dashboards and reports using visualization tools (e.g., Power BI).
• Conduct statistical analyses (e.g., regression, hypothesis testing) to support predictive and descriptive insights.
• Assist in building data models to enhance forecasting capabilities.

Requirements:
• Bachelors or Masters in a quantitative field (such as Engineering, Statistics, Math, Economics, or Computer Science with Modeling/Data Science), preferably with work experience of over 3 years.
• Proficiency in SQL for querying and database management.
• Strong skills in Python, R, or Excel for data analysis and modeling.
• Proven problem solving and debugging skills.
• Familiar with database technologies and tools (SQL/R/SAS/JMP etc.), data warehousing, transformation and processing. Work experience with real data for customer insights, business and market analysis will be advantageous.
• Experience with text analytics, data mining and social media analytics.
• Statistical knowledge in standard techniques: Logistic Regression, Classification models, Cluster Analysis, Neural Networks, Random Forests, Ensembles, etc.
• Excellent communication and presentation skills is a MUST

title: HR Senior Data Analyst
description:
Role Overview:
You will be joining the HR team as a detail-oriented and proactive HR Senior Data Analyst at Hitachi Digital. Your main responsibilities will include supporting HR reporting, managing HR reporting service tickets, and translating data into impactful visualizations and presentations. A foundational understanding of HR functions, proficiency in Excel, and comfort working on PowerPoint decks is essential for this role. Familiarity with Power BI will be considered a strong plus.

Key Responsibilities:
- Handle HR reporting tickets and queries, ensuring timely resolution and stakeholder satisfaction
- Collaborate with HRBPs and functional teams to understand data/reporting needs
- Prepare insightful presentations and decks using PowerPoint to support HR meetings and reviews for analyses
- Assist in workforce analytics, employee lifecycle tracking, and ad-hoc HR data requests using Excel (pivot tables, lookups, data cleaning, etc.)
- Work closely with the HRIS team to ensure data integrity and consistency
- Support data gathering for audits, compliance, and HR metrics reporting
- Leverage Power BI to create or update visual reports and dashboards

Qualification Required:
- 3-7 years of experience in an HR or HR analytics role
- Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, charts, formulas, etc.)
- Working knowledge of PowerPoint for corporate presentation creation
- Familiarity with HR processes, systems, and terminologies
- Experience handling HR service requests/tickets
- Good communication and stakeholder management skills
- Ability to handle multiple tasks and work in a fast-paced environment
- Exposure to or hands-on experience with Power BI,

title: Data Analyst (Job Vacancy)
description:
The role of
Data Analyst
is crucial in driving data-informed decision-making within our team. By leveraging analytical skills and innovative thinking, you will contribute significantly to our strategic goals and enhance our operational efficiency. This position offers a collaborative environment where you can grow your expertise while working alongside talented professionals dedicated to excellence.

As a
Data Analyst
, you will:

Analyze complex datasets to identify trends and insights that inform business strategies.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide actionable recommendations.

Develop and maintain dashboards and reports that visualize key performance indicators for stakeholders.

Utilize statistical methods to validate data integrity and ensure accuracy in reporting.

Support data-driven projects by providing analytical expertise and insights throughout the project lifecycle.

Conduct exploratory data analysis to uncover hidden patterns and opportunities for improvement.

Assist in the design and implementation of data collection systems and other strategies to optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.

Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in data analysis to continuously enhance our analytical capabilities.

Mentor junior analysts and contribute to a culture of learning and development within the team.

Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and compelling manner, fostering a data-driven culture.

To excel in this role, you should possess the following qualifications and skills:

Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar analytical role.

Strong proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, or R.

Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI.

Solid understanding of statistical analysis and data modeling techniques.

Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Ability to communicate complex data insights in a clear and concise manner.

Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.

Familiarity with database management and data warehousing concepts.

Knowledge of business intelligence principles and practices.

A degree in a relevant field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related discipline.

title: Data Analyst, Italian Language Translator
description:
About the Role:

Grade Level (for internal use):
07

Job Description

The Team: Translations department is part of the Financial Data Intelligence domain within the Market Intelligence division at S&P Global. The team is responsible for delivering accurate and timely translated content to internal financial and non-financial data collection teams within the division. It also supports translation requirements for other divisions as well as Corporate, Technology, Legal and News groups within the company.

The Impact: As a translator/linguist, you are responsible for producing quality translation in the target language. You will also be responsible for relevant and market specific research; data collection and analysis of the financial industry and other-related activities in the covered region through key processes established. Additionally, you will also maintain the most up-to-date market knowledge document through collaboration with relevant stakeholders and participate in projects to ensure the data integrity. This is reflected directly on the product that our clients use and support the company’s strategy in making S&P products available in target regions and industries.

What is in it for you:
• Have the opportunity to be a part of a large and growing Translations operation with over 300 employees across over 5 operating sites, that uses state-of-the-art translation processes and tools to deliver on the needs of internal customers not just within the division but the entire company.
• Be widely exposed to multiple data collection processes with a dependency on translation services within S&P Global.
• Be able to work with diverse and multicultural teams working out of Ahmedabad, Hyderabad, Manila, Penang, and Buenos Aires offices to achieve a common set of goals; and
Have insight into our clients and/or C-level executives at companies whose data we cover, collect and present.

Responsibilities:
• Convert (translate/localize) high-level documents in the source language to the target language Italian or German to English and vice-versa) by relaying the style and tone of the original language.
• Collect relevant financial information through primary research and secondary research.
• Ensure that queries from both internal and external clients are addressed accurately, comprehensively, and timely.
• Provide quality assurance of translated and localized materials.
• Create and maintain language glossaries, dictionaries, and translation memories utilized for translation, and draft language-specific style guides based on project requirements.
• Deliver on predefined individual and team targets including delivering outcomes with quality and excellence.
• Stay abreast of updated translation and research guidelines and policies.
• Daily reporting of work performed during the day in the reporting tools, including fixing of errors as per quality feedback within specified time and report back after completion.
• Participate in developing and executing projects as assigned from time to time as per company requirements. This encompasses expanding the market information and additional data coverage.
• Participate in testing new tools and application that would enhance individual and team productivity and efficiency.
• Ideate and execute Process Improvement and Automation projects.
• Escalate concerns on time and with correct line of communication and appropriate response to mails from co-workers & management team.
• Collaborate with other data sets and stakeholders in support of the team’s expansion and transformation goals.
• What We are Looking For:

Basic Qualifications:
• Proficiency or native competency in specified languages and English. Other languages are a plus.
• At least 2 years of relevant experience as translator
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and specified language and financial terms in the language
• Knowledge of Accounting and Financial subject matter, concepts, and terms. Preferred knowledge of financial statements (IS, BS, CF etc.), Key Ratios and other market-related data.
• Should have good analytical skills to conduct thorough objective research, and with good attention to detail.
• Well-versed with information research on the internet and desktop applications such as Microsoft Office 365 (MS Word, Excel, Teams, Outlook).
• Ability to interact with various levels and deal with issues in a mature and professional manner (excellent interpersonal skills to facilitate effective communication across teams)
• Must have the ability to work in a team as well as independently.
• Strong time management skills – must be able to prioritize, multi-task, and deliver regarding work deadlines, service level agreements, and targets set.
• Must have an inquisitive and investigative nature, and be proactive, highly motivated and have a positive attitude.
• Must be comfortable with learning modern technologies, processes, and tools.

Preferred Qualifications
• Language proficiency certification is desirable.
• Proven experience of active participation on translation and localization projects particularly related to financial industry/markets.
• Experience with Lean principles, automation, and machine translation.
• Knowledge in SQL, Python and VBA Macro is a plus.

What’s In It For You?

Our Mission:

Advancing Essential Intelligence.

Our People:

We're more than 35,000 strong worldwide—so we're able to understand nuances while having a broad perspective. Our team is driven by curiosity and a shared belief that Essential Intelligence can help build a more prosperous future for us all.From finding new ways to measure sustainability to analyzing energy transition across the supply chain to building workflow solutions that make it easy to tap into insight and apply it. We are changing the way people see things and empowering them to make an impact on the world we live in. We’re committed to a more equitable future and to helping our customers find new, sustainable ways of doing business. Join us and help create the critical insights that truly make a difference.

Our Values:
Integrity, Discovery, Partnership

Throughout our history, the world's leading organizations have relied on us for the Essential Intelligence they need to make confident decisions about the road ahead. We start with a foundation of integrity in all we do, bring a spirit of discovery to our work, and collaborate in close partnership with each other and our customers to achieve shared goals.

Benefits:

We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.

Our benefits include:
• Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
• Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
• Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
• Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
• Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
• Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.

For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries

Global Hiring and Opportunity at S&P Global:

At S&P Global, we are committed to fostering a connected and engaged workplace where all individuals have access to opportunities based on their skills, experience, and contributions. Our hiring practices emphasize fairness, transparency, and merit, ensuring that we attract and retain top talent. By valuing different perspectives and promoting a culture of respect and collaboration, we drive innovation and power global markets.

Recruitment Fraud Alert:

If you receive an email from a spglobalind.com domain or any other regionally based domains, it is a scam and should be reported to reportfraud@spglobal.com. S&P Global never requires any candidate to pay money for job applications, interviews, offer letters, “pre-employment training” or for equipment/delivery of equipment. Stay informed and protect yourself from recruitment fraud by reviewing our guidelines, fraudulent domains, and how to report suspicious activity here.

S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.

title: SQL Data and Statistical Analyst
description: Job Description:SQL Data and Statistical Analyst Support the team that tests autonomous vehicles. Core responsibilities: ? Create SQL queries to pull and aggregate data from tables of logs of autonomous driving from the real world and simulation. ? Correctly estimate rates of different types of behaviors with confidence intervals from sampled events using SQL. Experience with confidence interval calculation is required. ? Create dashboards to display rate estimates and simulation results with appropriate filtering capabilities. ? Follow-up with data scientists, systems engineers, and test engineers. ? Update queries for existing dashboards to reflect the latest release. ? Present overall status of rates and specific contributing logs and simulations. ? Improve the workflows by automation. Required: ? Strong ability to write SQL queries, SQL modules, and SQL tests, and maintain a high standard of readability and code health. ? Strong knowledge of statistics, including confidence interval calculations. ? 3-5 years of data analysis experience. ? Previous experience in program management, task tracking, or operations. ? Previous experience with program management software tools. (JIRA or equivalent) ? Strong understanding of databases and data pipelines. ? BS/MS in a technical field. Desired: ? Dashboards provide needed functionality for key stakeholders to understand rates and the contributing events quickly and easily. ? title: Business Analyst 3
description:
As a Business Analyst at Bristol Myers Squibb, you will play a crucial role in supporting data-driven decision-making processes, generating insights, and providing strategic guidance to optimize business operations in LATAM. Your expertise in forecasting, decision support, research, statistical analysis, real-world data analysis, digital analytics, and measurement will be essential. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, utilizing advanced analytical techniques to enhance business performance and drive growth.
• *Roles & Responsibilities:**
- Conduct analysis and interpretation of complex data sets to derive meaningful insights and recommendations.
- Create, oversee, and maintain forecasting models and techniques to project sales, demand, and market trends for biopharma products in LATAM markets.
- Collaborate with stakeholders to identify business problems, goals, and KPIs to develop analytical frameworks.
- Conduct research and collect real-world data from multiple sources to support business strategies and decision-making.
- Perform statistical analyses, data mining, and predictive modeling to uncover trends and correlations.
- Work closely with cross-functional teams to design and implement digital analytics initiatives and measurement frameworks to optimize marketing campaigns and customer engagement.
- Prepare reports, dashboards, and presentations to communicate findings, insights, and recommendations to stakeholders at various levels of the organization.
- Collaborate with IT teams to develop and enhance data infrastructure, data pipelines, and analytical tools for efficient data collection, processing, and analysis.
- Stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies.
- Provide training, guidance, and mentorship to junior analysts and team members when required.
• *Skills and Competencies:**
- Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze complex data sets and draw meaningful conclusions.
- Proficiency in statistical analysis techniques, predictive modeling, and forecasting methodologies.
- Strong project management skills and the ability to work independently or as part of a team.
- Solid understanding of digital analytics tools and platforms (e.g., Google Analytics).
- Strong communication skills with the ability to present complex information to non-technical stakeholders in a clear manner.
- Strong business acumen and strategic thinking, with the ability to translate analytical findings into actionable insights and recommendations.
• *Experience:**
- Bachelor's or master's degree in technology or engineering with a strong record of analytic and quantitative work.
- 5+ years in a similar business analyst role, preferably within the biopharma or pharmaceutical industry.
- Experience in working with real-world data, large datasets, data visualization tools, and statistical software packages (e.g., R, Python, SAS).
- Familiarity with regulatory requirements and compliance in the biopharma industry.
- Experience with real-world data analysis, digital analytics, and market research methodologies.
- Certification or training in relevant analytics or business intelligence tools is a plus.

If you come across a role that intrigues you but doesn't perfectly line up with your resume, Bristol Myers Squibb encourages you to apply anyway as you could be one step away from work that will transform your life and career.,

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Business Unit:

Cubic Transportation Systems

Company Details:

When you join Cubic, you become part of a company that creates and delivers technology solutions in transportation to make people's lives easier by simplifying their daily journeys, and defense capabilities to help promote mission success and safety for those who serve their nation. Led by our talented teams around the world, Cubic is committed to solving global issues through innovation and service to our customers and partners.

We have a top-tier portfolio of businesses, including Cubic Transportation Systems (CTS) and Cubic Defense (CD). Explore more on Cubic.com.

Job Details:

The Senior Data Analyst will play a critical role within CTS's Global Analytics function, supporting key transit programs across North America, Australia, and India. This role is accountable for transforming complex operational, performance, and customer datasets into actionable insights that drive service excellence, contractual KPI/SLA compliance, predictive decision-making, and continuous improvement.
You will work with large-scale data pipelines, develop high-quality analytical solutions, and partner closely with engineering, reporting, operations, and customer success teams to deliver data-driven outcomes for major transit agencies.
Key Responsibilities

The following are the key responsibilities of the position. It is expected that most, if not all of these, are met by the candidate:
• Develop, maintain, and optimize SQL-based datasets across Oracle and SQL Server environments, ensuring data quality, consistency, and reliability.
• Perform complex data wrangling, cleansing, modelling, and transformation required for operational analytics, KPI reporting, and performance insights.
• Build and maintain analytical datasets and scripts using Python to support automation, predictions, and advanced analysis.
• Work with large and complex datasets from multiple operational systems (ServiceNow, device telemetry, transaction data, ODS/EDW).
• Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and data models in Power BI, including DAX, scheduled refresh, and governance-aligned practices.
• Support and enhance CTS's KPI Engine and performance measurement frameworks, ensuring compliance with contractual KPIs and SLAs across global programs.
• Apply data science and ML concepts (e.g., classification, regression, clustering, feature engineering, model evaluation) to support predictive maintenance, anomaly detection, and optimization initiatives.
• Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to understand requirements, translate them into analytical solutions, and deliver insights that inform decisions.
• Conduct deep-dive root-cause analysis on operational issues, device performance problems, and service incidents to support continuous improvement.
• Document analytical logic, data definitions, and technical processes following CTS governance and COE standards.
• Ensure data integrity, validation, and adherence to security and compliance requirements.

Required Skills and Qualifications
• Bachelor's/master's degree in Comp Science, Data Analytics, Engineering, Mathematics, or related field.
• 5+ years of experience in data analysis, analytics engineering, or data science roles.
• Expert-level SQL skills in both Oracle and SQL Server (complex joins, window functions, CTEs, performance tuning).
• Strong experience with Python for analytics, automation, and ML experimentation.
• Proven ability to work with very large datasets, multi-source systems, and complex business logic.
• Deep understanding of data transformation, modelling, pipelines, and ETL/ELT processes.
• Experience working with KPI/SLA-driven environments, producing measurement logic and detailed performance analysis.
• Working knowledge of Power BI (modeling, DAX, optimisation, power query etc.)
• Strong understanding of data science fundamentals including data preparation, model development workflows, and evaluation metrics.
• Ability to translate ambiguous or complex requirements into structured analytical solutions.

Preferred Skills
• Hands-on experience with Azure (ADF, SQL, Databricks, Data Lake) or other cloud data platforms.
• Experience working in a transportation, operations, SaaS, or managed services environment.
• Exposure to predictive maintenance, device health analytics, or operational reliability analytics.
• Familiarity with version control (Git), DevOps, CI/CD data workflows.
• Experience with data visualization best practices and storytelling techniques.
• Knowledge of ServiceNow data models (incidents, requests, tasks, changes) is an advantage.

Soft Skills
• Strong analytical mindset with exceptional problem-solving abilities.
• Ability to work independently and take ownership of deliverables.
• Excellent communication skills-capable of simplifying complex concepts for non-technical stakeholders.
• Comfortable working in a fast-paced, global, multi-time zone team.
• High attention to detail, data quality, and accuracy.
• Strong sense of accountability, adaptability, and continuous improvement.
• Ability to engage effectively with engineering, operations, and business stakeholders.
• Proactive, resourceful, and committed to delivering high-quality outcomes.

Role Impact & Success Measures

The Senior Data Analyst will directly support CTS's global analytics capability by delivering high-quality insights, strengthening KPI/SLA measurement, and enabling data-driven decision-making across major transit programs. Success in this role is defined by strong analytical delivery, reliable data models, and meaningful contributions to operational and predictive initiatives.
Success in the First 3-6 Months
• Build a solid understanding of CTS datasets, KPI frameworks, and key operational systems.
• Deliver accurate SQL/Python transformations and enhanced Power BI reports.
• Improve data quality through validation, investigation, and documentation.
• Support program teams with timely analysis that reduces manual reporting effort.
Success in 6-12 Months
• Take ownership of end-to-end analytical workstreams with minimal supervision.
• Strengthen and automate KPI/SLA logic within the KPI Engine.
• Develop initial predictive analytics models (classification/regression) to support reliability or device health insights.
• Improve reporting efficiency by identifying and automating repetitive tasks.
• Build strong relationships with global stakeholders and act as a trusted analytics partner.
Long-Term Success (12+ Months)
• Contribute to CTS Analytics strategy, standards, and global operating model improvements.
• Become a subject matter expert in CTS operational datasets and KPI structures.
• Lead continuous improvement initiatives that enhance data quality, automation, and analytical maturity.
• Provide mentoring and technical leadership to uplift junior team members.

Worker Type:

Employee

title: Data Analyst, Translation
description:
About the Role:

Grade Level (for internal use):
07Job Description

ob Description

The Team: Translations department is part of the Financial Data Intelligence domain within the Market Intelligence division at S&P Global. The team is responsible for delivering accurate and timely translated content to internal financial and non-financial data collection teams within the division. It also supports translation requirements for other divisions as well as Corporate, Technology, Legal and News groups within the company.

The Impact: As a translator/linguist, you are responsible for producing quality translation in the target language. You will also be responsible for relevant and market specific research; data collection and analysis of the financial industry and other-related activities in the covered region through key processes established. Additionally, you will also maintain the most up-to-date market knowledge document through collaboration with relevant stakeholders and participate in projects to ensure the data integrity. This is reflected directly on the product that our clients use and support the company’s strategy in making S&P products available in target regions and industries.

What is in it for you:
• Have the opportunity to be a part of a large and growing Translations operation with over 300 employees across over 5 operating sites, that uses state-of-the-art translation processes and tools to deliver on the needs of internal customers not just within the division but the entire company.
• Be widely exposed to multiple data collection processes with a dependency on translation services within S&P Global.
• Be able to work with diverse and multicultural teams working out of Ahmedabad, Hyderabad, Manila, Penang, and Buenos Aires offices to achieve a common set of goals; and
Have insight into our clients and/or C-level executives at companies whose data we cover, collect and present.

Responsibilities:
• Convert (translate/localize) high-level documents in the source language to the target language (Portuguese or Italian or German to English and vice-versa) by relaying the style and tone of the original language.
• Collect relevant financial information through primary research and secondary research.
• Ensure that queries from both internal and external clients are addressed accurately, comprehensively, and timely.
• Provide quality assurance of translated and localized materials.
• Create and maintain language glossaries, dictionaries, and translation memories utilized for translation, and draft language-specific style guides based on project requirements.
• Deliver on predefined individual and team targets including delivering outcomes with quality and excellence.
• Stay abreast of updated translation and research guidelines and policies.
• Daily reporting of work performed during the day in the reporting tools, including fixing of errors as per quality feedback within specified time and report back after completion.
• Participate in developing and executing projects as assigned from time to time as per company requirements. This encompasses expanding the market information and additional data coverage.
• Participate in testing new tools and application that would enhance individual and team productivity and efficiency.
• Ideate and execute Process Improvement and Automation projects.
• Escalate concerns on time and with correct line of communication and appropriate response to mails from co-workers & management team.
• Collaborate with other data sets and stakeholders in support of the team’s expansion and transformation goals.
• What We are Looking For:

Basic Qualifications:
• Proficiency or native competency in specified languages and English. Other languages are a plus.
• At least 2 years of relevant experience as translator
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and specified language and financial terms in the language
• Knowledge of Accounting and Financial subject matter, concepts, and terms. Preferred knowledge of financial statements (IS, BS, CF etc.), Key Ratios and other market-related data.
• Should have good analytical skills to conduct thorough objective research, and with good attention to detail.
• Well-versed with information research on the internet and desktop applications such as Microsoft Office 365 (MS Word, Excel, Teams, Outlook).
• Ability to interact with various levels and deal with issues in a mature and professional manner (excellent interpersonal skills to facilitate effective communication across teams)
• Must have the ability to work in a team as well as independently.
• Strong time management skills – must be able to prioritize, multi-task, and deliver regarding work deadlines, service level agreements, and targets set.
• Must have an inquisitive and investigative nature, and be proactive, highly motivated and have a positive attitude.
• Must be comfortable with learning modern technologies, processes, and tools.

Preferred Qualifications
• Language proficiency certification is desirable.
• Proven experience of active participation on translation and localization projects particularly related to financial industry/markets.
• Experience with Lean principles, automation, and machine translation.
• Knowledge in SQL, Python and VBA Macro is a plus.

What’s In It For You?

Our Mission:

Advancing Essential Intelligence.

Our People:

We're more than 35,000 strong worldwide—so we're able to understand nuances while having a broad perspective. Our team is driven by curiosity and a shared belief that Essential Intelligence can help build a more prosperous future for us all.From finding new ways to measure sustainability to analyzing energy transition across the supply chain to building workflow solutions that make it easy to tap into insight and apply it. We are changing the way people see things and empowering them to make an impact on the world we live in. We’re committed to a more equitable future and to helping our customers find new, sustainable ways of doing business. Join us and help create the critical insights that truly make a difference.

Our Values:
Integrity, Discovery, Partnership

Throughout our history, the world's leading organizations have relied on us for the Essential Intelligence they need to make confident decisions about the road ahead. We start with a foundation of integrity in all we do, bring a spirit of discovery to our work, and collaborate in close partnership with each other and our customers to achieve shared goals.

Benefits:

We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.

Our benefits include:
• Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
• Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
• Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
• Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
• Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
• Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.

For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries

Global Hiring and Opportunity at S&P Global:

At S&P Global, we are committed to fostering a connected and engaged workplace where all individuals have access to opportunities based on their skills, experience, and contributions. Our hiring practices emphasize fairness, transparency, and merit, ensuring that we attract and retain top talent. By valuing different perspectives and promoting a culture of respect and collaboration, we drive innovation and power global markets.

If you receive an email from a spglobalind.com domain or any other regionally based domains, it is a scam and should be reported to reportfraud@spglobal.com. title: Epic Cogito Data Analyst
description:
Cogito Data Analyst – Remote Role for U.S. Healthcare Projects (Based in India)

Contract | 12-Month Assignment | Pacific Standard Hours

Take your analytics career global! This is an opportunity to work remotely for a U.S. healthcare organization while being based in India. As an Epic Cogito Data Analyst , you’ll leverage your expertise to deliver high-quality analytics solutions that drive smarter decisions and improve patient care.

Why This Role Stands Out
• Work for a U.S. Organization : Gain international exposure without relocating.
• Remote Flexibility : Enjoy work-life balance while contributing to high-impact projects.
• Skill Growth : Strengthen your experience with advanced analytics tools and global healthcare data.

What You’ll Do
• Build dashboards and reports that transform complex clinical and financial data into actionable insights.
• Collaborate with U.S.-based business units and developers to design solutions that optimize workflows and reduce costs.
• Translate business requirements into technical solutions using Epic Cogito tools and SQL.

What You Bring
• Experience : 3+ years as a Data Analyst with strong Epic Cogito expertise.
• Technical Skills : Proficiency in SQL, ETL processes, and tools like Slicer Dicer & Data Courier.
• Healthcare Knowledge : Familiarity with healthcare data and terminology.
• Communication : Ability to clearly convey technical solutions to business stakeholders.

Preferred Extras
• Epic Certification
• Experience creating intuitive dashboards and visualizations

$9.00 - $15.00 Per hour

Exact compensation may vary based on several factors, including skills, experience, and education.

Benefit packages for this role will start on the 31st day of employment and include medical, dental, and vision insurance, as well as HSA, FSA, and DCFSA account options, and 401k retirement account access with employer matching. Employees in this role are also entitled to paid sick leave and / or other paid time off as provided by applicable law.

title: Data Analyst - Remote (Hyderabad)
description:
We're hiring a Data Analyst/Scientist for AI Training | Earn Up to $5,000/Month

Location : India (Remote)

Role Overview

We are seeking highly skilled Data Analysts and Data Scientists to contribute to AI model development. In this role, you will work with datasets, apply analytical methods, and provide insights that improve AI performance.

Key Responsibilities

Why Join Us?

title: Medical Data Analyst I
description:
Opportunity Overview:

Full-time position in-office Hyderabad. This position will require the candidate to engage in critical thinking skills be intellectually curious and demonstrate great attention to detail. Requires excellent communications skills both written and oral. Must possess the ability to work with a diverse group of talent both in-person and globally.

What youll do:
• Data Validation and Verification: Perform meticulous line-by-line comparisons of algorithm-generated output sheets (in CSV format) against the original patient
• Accuracy Assessment: Verify the accurate extraction of key medical data including Vital Signs and Laboratory Tests. This includes checking the accuracy of Test Names Test Results/Values Units of Measurement and associated Date/Time stamps.
• Error Identification and Documentation: Identify and meticulously document any discrepancies errors or failures in data extraction where the algorithm has incorrectly or incompletely captured data from the EMR.
• Systematically document findings in the Algorithm Output Sheet using specific columns. Set the Status (Correct/Incorrect) based on the comparison. Provide detailed error categorization in the Sub Status column
• Specify the correct data in the Expected Test Name Expected Test Value Expected Unit of Measurement and Expected Date Timestamp columns for any identified error.
• Completeness Reporting: Report any missing medical data that was present in the EMR but was not extracted by the algorithm into the output sheet.
• Quality Assurance Contribution: Collaborate closely with the Data Science Team by providing high-quality actionable feedback to drive continuous improvement in algorithm performance and data extraction logic.

Required Qualifications
• Proven background or strong familiarity with Electronic Medical Records (EMRs) and clinical data such as laboratory reports vital signs procedures and treatments.
• Demonstrate commitment to accuracy and exceptional attention to detail.
• Excellent analytical and critical thinking skills to compare complex clinical documentation against structured data formats.

Education Qualifications:
• BSC Nursing Food and Nutrition Graduation- BSC MSC (Life sciences) MLT.
• Knowledge of Medical Terminology Human Anatomy and Physiology.

Ability to commute/relocate:
• Nacharam Hyderabad Telangana: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Interview Process*:
• Connect with the Talent Acquisition Team for a Preliminary Phone Screening
• Hiring Manager Interview
• Take-home assessment
• Peer and/or cross-functional interview(s)
• Subject to change

About ZignaAI a Cohere Health Company:

Cohere Healths clinical intelligence platform delivers AI-powered solutions that streamline access to quality care by improving payer-provider collaboration cost containment and healthcare economics. Cohere Health works with over 660000 providers and handles over 12 million prior authorization requests annually. Its responsible AI auto-approves up to 90% of requests for millions of health plan members.

With the acquisition of ZignaAI weve further enhanced our platform by launching our Payment Integrity Suite anchored by Cohere Validate an AI-driven clinical and coding validation solution that operates in near real-time. By unifying pre-service authorization data with post-service claims validation were creating a transparent healthcare ecosystem that reduces waste improves payer-provider collaboration and patient outcomes and ensures providers are paid promptly and accurately.

Cohere Healths innovations continue to receive industry wide recognition. Weve been named to the 2025 Inc. 5000 list and in the Gartner Hype Cycle for U.S. Healthcare Payers (2022-2025) and ranked as a Top 5 LinkedIn Startup for 2023 & 2024. Backed by leading investors such as Deerfield Management Define Ventures Flare Capital Partners Longitude Capital and Polaris Partners Cohere Health drives more transparent streamlined healthcare processes helping patients receive faster more appropriate care and higher-quality outcomes.

The Coherenauts as we call ourselves who succeed here are empathetic teammates who are candid kind caring and embody our core values and principles . We believe that diverse inclusive teams make the most impactful work. Cohere is deeply invested in ensuring that we have a supportive growth-oriented environment that works for everyone.

We cant wait to learn more about you and meet you at ZignaAI a Cohere Health company!

Equal Opportunity Statement:

Cohere Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to fostering an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all. To us its personal.

title: Executive Manager- Data Analyst (Mosaic AI)
description:
Overview

Data Analyst will be responsible to partner closely with business and S&T teams in preparing final analysis reports for the stakeholders enabling them to make important decisions based on various facts and trends and lead data requirement, source analysis, data analysis, data transformation and reconciliation activities. This role will be interacting with DG, DPM, EA, DE, EDF, PO and D &Ai teams for historical data requirement and sourcing the data for Mosaic AI program to scale solution to new markets.

Responsibilities
• Lead data requirement, source analysis, data analysis, data transformation and reconciliation activities.
• Partners with FP&A Product Owner and associated business SME's to understand & document business requirements and associated needs
• Performs the analysis of business data requirements and translates into a data design that satisfies local, sector and global requirements
• Using automated tools to extract data from primary and secondary sources.
• Using statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets could be helpful for the diagnosis and prediction.
• Working with engineers, and business teams to identify process improvement opportunities, propose system modifications.
• Proactively identifies impediments and looks for pragmatic and constructive solutions to mitigate risk.
• Be a champion for continuous improvement and drive efficiency.
• Preference will be given to candidate having functional understanding of financial concepts (P&L, Balance Sheet, Operating Expense) .

Qualifications
• Bachelor of Technology.
• Minimum 9+ years of relevant work experience on data modelling / analytics, experience of navigating data in Azure Databricks, Synapse, Teradata or similar database technologies
• Expertise in SQL, Pyspark to analyse data for both development validation and operational support is critical
• Experience in team handling.
• Preferred skills Azure (Databricks, Data Factory, Date Lake Store Gen2)
• Exposure to GenAI - Good Communication & Presentation skill is must for this role.
